page.title: 17Getting the News in Well
page.content: A newsletter is delivered to each house giving news items and reports of the villages.Local news is included in the Darlington & Stockton Times.News- papers and magazines are collected from the shop.Radio is used by most people and nearly all homes have a colour T.V. Reception is satisfactory except that Yorkshire I.T.V. can only be received with a special aerial at the south east of the village.The mobile library calls fortnightly and is used by 15-20 people. {Making Contact Outside Well Letters are delivered upto 10.45am and collected at 10am & 3.40pm.One middle aged mum confined to a wheel chair is a C.B. enthusiast and enjoys chatting to friends and can summon up help quickly.She made 4 999 calls for A1 accidents this year.One radio ham has made and met friends over the world.
